title: Daily Market Digest: February 24, 2026
subtitle: Market attempts a rebound amid lingering tariff and AI concerns

items.headline: U.S. Stocks Steadier After Monday's Slide
items.summary: U.S. equities showed signs of stabilizing on Tuesday, attempting a rebound after significant losses on Monday. The market remains cautious as investors navigate uncertainties around new global tariffs and ongoing concerns over artificial intelligence's disruptive impact on various sectors. While major indices edged higher in morning trading, fears of an AI-induced shake-up in the tech sector and geopolitical tensions continue to influence sentiment.

items.statContext: Up 0.61% (as of 11:54 AM ET). On Monday, it lost 1.04% to close at 6,837.75.
Up 0.4% (as of 10:05 AM ET). On Monday, it fell 1.7% to close at 48,804.06.
Up 0.2% (as of 10:05 AM ET). On Monday, it declined 1.1% to close at 22,627.27.

items.headline: Vir Biotechnology surges on prostate cancer drug partnership
items.summary: Shares of Vir Biotechnology surged after announcing a partnership with Astellas Pharma to develop and commercialize a CD3 T-cell engager for metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer.

items.headline: Clarivate jumps on upbeat Q4 and potential divestiture
items.summary: Clarivate's shares soared following strong Q4 results and news of active discussions to sell its Life Sciences & Healthcare segment, aiming to reduce leverage and strengthen its balance sheet.

items.headline: Keysight Technologies rallies on strong FQ1 and outlook
items.summary: Keysight Technologies saw a significant jump after its FQ1 results and outlook surpassed estimates, driven by robust demand from AI, aerospace and defense, and semiconductor test markets.

items.headline: AMD climbs on Meta AI infrastructure partnership
items.summary: Advanced Micro Devices shares climbed after announcing a multi-year AI infrastructure partnership with Meta Platforms, which could involve Meta deploying up to 6 gigawatts of AMD Instinct chips.

items.headline: Home Depot gains on earnings beat and dividend hike
items.summary: Home Depot rose after reporting stronger-than-expected profits and revenue for the end of 2025, and also increased its quarterly dividend.

items.headline: Novo Nordisk tumbles on CagriSema trial data
items.summary: U.S.-traded shares of Novo Nordisk tumbled after trial data for its CagriSema drug showed people lost a smaller percentage of weight than with a rival drug from Eli Lilly.

items.headline: CrowdStrike drops amid AI disruption fears in cybersecurity
items.summary: CrowdStrike Holdings, Inc. fell sharply, as the cybersecurity industry faced worries of disruption following Anthropic's unveiling of a new AI-powered code-scanning tool.

items.headline: AppLovin sinks on AI competition worries
items.summary: AppLovin sank amidst rising concerns that AI competition will impact software companies by stealing customers and fundamentally reshaping their industries.

items.headline: Airlines fall due to widespread flight cancellations
items.summary: United Airlines lost ground as heavy snow and high winds led to the cancellation of thousands of flights across the busy Northeast.

items.headline: Microsoft declines as tech stocks face AI disruption concerns
items.summary: Microsoft Corporation's shares fell as tech stocks continued to be weighed down by concerns over AI-induced disruption in the market.

items.headline: Rotation Towards 'Real Economy' Stocks Continues
items.summary: Industrial, consumer defensive, and energy sectors are leading the stock market higher in 2026, outperforming technology as investors seek returns beyond the AI trade. Industrials, up over 16% this year, are benefiting from the AI data center buildout with companies like Caterpillar ($CAT) supplying generators. Consumer defensives, up 13.3% led by Walmart ($WMT) and Costco ($COST), are gaining from slowing consumer spending. Energy stocks, up more than 22% with Exxon Mobil ($XOM) and Chevron ($CVX) at the forefront, are propelled by rising oil prices.

items.headline: Technology and Communication Services Lag Amid AI Disruption Fears
items.summary: Technology and Communication Services sectors are among those faltering, as fears of AI-induced disruption intensify. The U.S. Software sector has already dropped 22% this month due to concerns that AI tools could replace software services and lead to widespread job losses.

items.headline: Financials Underperform, VIX Rises
items.summary: On Monday, the Financials Select Sector SPDR ($XLF) fell 3.3%, indicating significant underperformance. The CBOE Volatility Index (VIX), a fear gauge, increased by 10.1% to 21.01, reflecting heightened market uncertainty.

items.headline: U.S. Consumer Confidence Improves in February
items.summary: The Conference Board Consumer Confidence Index increased by 2.2 points to 91.2 in February, up from a revised 89.0 in January. Consumers showed less pessimism about future business conditions, despite some softening in planned spending on services. This data, with a cutoff of February 17, 2026, suggests a slight easing in pessimistic expectations.

items.headline: Fed Governor Signals 'Coin Flip' on March Rate Cut
items.summary: Federal Reserve Governor Christopher Waller stated on Monday that there's a 'coin flip' chance on whether the Fed will cut its main interest rate at its next meeting in March or maintain current levels.

items.headline: New 10% Global Tariffs Take Effect, Causing Trade Uncertainty
items.summary: New 10% global tariffs went live today, February 24, 2026, utilizing Trade Act authority after the U.S. Supreme Court blocked earlier reciprocal levies. This policy change is fueling a 2% spike in gold prices as a safe-haven asset, and Japan has expressed intentions to scrutinize the impact on its industries. The uncertainty surrounding U.S. trade policy continues to weigh on market sentiment.

items.headline: Home Depot and Keysight Deliver Strong Earnings
items.summary: Home Depot ($HD) announced fourth-quarter and fiscal 2025 results that exceeded analyst expectations for both profit and revenue, also raising its quarterly dividend. Keysight Technologies ($KEYS) reported FQ1 results and an outlook that topped estimates, driven by demand in AI, aerospace and defense, and semiconductor test markets.

items.headline: Nvidia Q4 Earnings Expected Tomorrow, Key for AI Sector
items.summary: Nvidia ($NVDA) is scheduled to release its results for the fourth quarter of fiscal year 2026 tomorrow, February 25, 2026, after market close. This report is highly anticipated and will be a critical reference point for the semiconductor and broader AI sector, influencing discussions on the 'peak AI' narrative.
